title: Israel says it killed Hamas chief Sinwar in Gaza
summary: Israel accuses 61-year-old Yahya Sinwar of masterminding the October 7, 2023 attack. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that Israel has 'settled its account' with Sinwar but that the 'war has not yet ended,' adding in a video statement that Palestinian militants should free the hostages if they want to live.

title: EU leaders urge new laws to speed up migrant returns
summary: On Thursday the EU chief said other ideas discussed at the summit included reviewing the concept of 'safe third country' – nations asylum seekers can be legally sent back to – and working with UN agencies to help 'stranded' migrants to return to their country of origin.

title: Giorgia Meloni visits Beirut amid tensions with Israel
summary: The Italian prime minister will visit Beirut on Friday, as Italy is one of the main contingents of UNIFIL in the south of the country, which is under attack from the Israeli army.

title: Emmanuel Macron and his PM Michel Barnier fight for influence over European affairs
summary: For the prime minister, France's EU policy is a sphere of influence that is shared between the Elysée and the premiership. For the president, it's his 'reserved domain.'

title: French mass rape trial: 'You're pleading it was an accident repeated six times?'
summary: Four of Dominique Pelicot's 50 co-defendants repeatedly visited the couple's home to rape his wife. Some of them, like Dominique P., still try to deny the facts of the case.

title: In Italy, lesbian couples fight to retain their parental status
summary: 'Parenting Abroad.' Twice a month, one of our journalists abroad explores parenthood beyond our borders. Giorgia Meloni's government is denying LGBT couples the right to form a family and is using the courts to undo some gains achieved by progressive mayors, notably in Padua.

title: Payal Kapadia, director of 'All We Imagine as Light': 'In India, independent cinema no longer has the support of the state'
summary: The Indian filmmaker, winner of the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival, talked to 'Le Monde' about the shooting of her feature film in Bombay.

title: Zelensky defends 'victory plan' at EU and NATO
summary: The Ukrainian president said on Thursday that his country must be in a position of strength before any peace talks with Russia. Zelensky also said he had intelligence reports that North Korea was training 10,000 soldiers to support Russia in its fight against Kyiv, but NATO chief Mark Rutte said there is 'no evidence' of this claim.

title: Northern Gaza's Jabaliya camp residents caught in a death trap
summary: The Israeli army is intensifying strikes on the devastated city, where residents also suffer from Israel's orchestrated restrictions on the arrival of humanitarian aid. Washington has called for an increase in aid entering the enclave.

title: In Belgium, the pope calling abortion doctors 'hitmen' sparks a wave of debaptisms
summary: By denouncing a 'criminal law' permitting abortion during his visit to the country, Pope Francis drew sharp criticism.

title: Immigration takes center stage once again at the European Council's autumn meeting
summary: Amid Italy sending asylum seekers to Albania and Poland aiming to partly suspend the right to asylum, Ursula von der Leyen has proposed that EU countries consider 'innovative ways' to prevent irregular entries.

title: Nevada grapples with a housing crisis, a central theme of the presidential campaign
summary: Despite an economic recovery in Las Vegas, the state still faces higher poverty and unemployment rates compared to the rest of the country. The two presidential candidates are neck and neck in the race.

title: Trump appears more extremist than ever in final campaign stretch
summary: Surrounded by the US justice system, the Republican candidate is prepared to tell any lie to avoid his own political demise before the November election.

title: How Germany, once a model for welcoming refugees, switched to border control
summary: Under Angela Merkel, Germany welcomed over a million refugees from 2015 to 2016, approved by most of the political spectrum. Yet public support soon waned and the far right exploited rejection of this policy.

title: In Lebanon's Beqaa Valley, Hezbollah's historic stronghold: 'There's nothing but distress'
summary: For over three weeks, the region has been echoing with the sound of Israel's intensive bombing campaign. The remaining inhabitants, most of them farmers, tally the hundreds of people who have been killed or wounded.

title: Far-right fake jobs trial: Marine Le Pen relishes the European Parliament's mistakes
summary: The far-right leader was able to prove that the administration had drawn up a fake contract to correct an error.

title: Harris' Fox News interview gets combative while Trump gives her rare compliments
summary: During a 30-minute Fox News interview, Harris clashed with interviewer Bret Baier on hot-button issues, with Baier often talking over her. At a Miami event, Trump was asked to name things he likes about Harris.

title: One Direction ex-singer Liam Payne dies after fall from Argentina hotel balcony
summary: The 31-year-old solo artist, who rose to fame with the boy band in 2010, fell from the third floor of a hotel in Buenos Aires on Wednesday, a police statement said.

title: How aging is shaking up our societies
summary: As the beginning of the baby-boom generation reaches its 80th birthday, all developed countries are affected by historic aging, accelerated by the recent drop in the birth rate. The budgetary shock – pensions and healthcare – will be major.

title: French IPA beers: Le Monde's selection
summary: Sweet or bitter, with hints of citrus, exotic fruits or even reminiscent of a milkshake, IPAs cater to every taste.

title: In Cameroon, the health of President Paul Biya is on everyone's mind, but no one is allowed to talk about it
summary: The 91-year-old head of state has not appeared in public since the China-Africa summit in Beijing in early September, but the government has 'strictly prohibited' any media discussion of his state of health.

title: Body of missing French teenager found after 13-month search
summary: Police had been searching for the 15-year-old – referred to only as 'Lina' in French media – since her mysterious disappearance on September 23 last year.

title: Harris warns voters of 'consequences' if Trump gets back to Oval Office: 'This is going to be a tight race'
summary: Meanwhile, Trump sat for an interview with a supportive podcast, talking immigration, the economy and his grievances against the US media, although he made news by blaming Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky for Russia's invasion of his country.
